action.primary: Tonifies the Kidneys and strengthens Yang

indications: Kidney Yang Deficiency with impotence, male or female infertility, premature ejaculation, urinary frequency,
Incontinence, irregular menstruation and a cold and painful back

action.primary: Disperses Wind-Cold-Damp and strengthens the sinews and bones

indications: Wind-Cold-Damp Bi with Kidney and Liver insufficiency with tight muscles of the lower back and legs, joint pain and difficulty moving

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Damp-Heat in the Lower Jiao.
Contraindicated for those with Yin Deficiency with Heat signs.
Contraindicated for those with Difficult urination.
Contraindicated for those with dry constipation, a bitter taste, red and painful eyes or restless irritability.
incompatibilities: Antagonizes Rx. Salviae Miltiorrhizae #{DanShen} Dan Shen.

useCases: Impotence, spermatorrhea and premature ejaculation due to Kidney Yang Deficiency.
Urinary incontinence and frequency due to Kidney Yang Deficiency.
Long-term Cold in the Womb with irregular menstruation and clear vaginal discharge.
Impotence or infertility associated with waning of Ming Men Fire.
Pain, swelling, muscular weakness and atrophy due to chronic Bi with deficient Kidneys.

notes: It tonifies Jing and benefits marrow.
It quiets and soothes the five Zang.
It is specifically for skeletal problems.
It is considered to have a minor action in augmenting Blood.
It is an herb of the Kidney channel, Blood level and Chong Channel.
It is an important herb in Kidney tonification because it is moist in nature.

Ba Ji Tian, Hb. Epimedii #{YinYangHuo} Yin Yang Huo and Rz. Curculiginis #{XianMao} Xian Mao all reinforce the Kidney Yang, strengthen the sinews and bones and expel Wind-Dampness. Xian Mao is the hottest and most acrid and strongly expels Cold-Dampness but its slight toxicity makes it appropriate only for short term use. Ba Ji Tian is acrid, sweet and only slightly warming with a soft, moistening quality that tonifies Yang without being overly dry or cloying. It also augment Jing. Yin Yang Huo is warmer and more markedly strengthens Ming Men Fire, while strongly dispersing Wind-Dampness and unblocking Bi.

Salt-prepared Morinda Yan Ba Ji is better able to enter the Kidney channel, augment primal Yang and replenish Yin water. it is appropriate to treat impotence or spermatorrhea due to Kidney Jing Deficiency.
Processed Morinda Zhi Ba Ji is more moderate in nature so that it tonifies Fire but does not overly dry Yin.
